info.game_comments:
2019 Teachers Tournament semifinal game 2.
Category names in the Jeopardy! Round read by Amazon Alexa.

(1, 1).clue: This Nevada city was founded in May 1905 on 110 acres that would eventually become the city's downtown

(2, 1).clue: If you are being "called on" this floor covering, you are being reprimanded

(3, 1).clue: In 2017 he received an honorary doctorate & delivered the commencement address at his alma mater, USC

(4, 1).clue: In some legends, this sorcerer teaches the Lady of the Lake magic & she uses it to imprison him in an enchanted thorn bush

(5, 1).clue: Treadmill users, subtract your age from 200 to get your maximum heart rate that's measured in BPM, short for this

(6, 1).clue: Each fall in the Arctic, a herd of these deer--as many as 250,000--travels south to feed in forested regions

(1, 2).clue: Joan of Arc lifted the Siege of Orleans in May 1429, turning the tide in this long conflict

(2, 2).clue: Accusing someone of a failing that you also have? That's this expression that mentions 2 pieces of cookware
(2, 2).correct response: the pot calling the kettle black

(3, 2).clue: On receiving the Mark Twain Prize for Humor, she thanked Sarah Palin: "My...resemblance & her crazy voice are the 2 luckiest things"

(4, 2).clue: The crown-of-thorns species of this marine creature is multi-armed & dangerous to coral reefs

(5, 2).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew demonstrates a resistance band.) Let's blast those biceps! With your muscles fully stretched, resistance will be greater as you rise using a band to do these

(6, 2).clue: Some say the name of this beloved dish is from Quebecois slang for a mess

(1, 3).clue: These criminals known for robbery & violence were shot dead on May 23, 1934

(2, 3).clue: Temporarily staying in a series of other people's homes with makeshift sleeping arrangements is doing this--hang ten!

(3, 3).clue: She's given voice to characters in "The Emoji Movie" & "The Nut Job"

(4, 3).clue: A thwarted love affair between a Catholic priest & a young woman in Australia is at the heart of this 1977 bestseller

(5, 3).clue: Proverbially, you do it to "the numbers"; physically, you do it to your abs, on your back with your knees bent & feet flat

(6, 3).clue: 25,000 volunteers helped out with the 2010 Winter Olympics hosted by this western city

(1, 4).clue: Father of the famous Quaker, Admiral William Penn failed to take Hispaniola from the Spanish in April of 1655, but did capture this island in May

(2, 4).clue: "The hand that" does this "rules the world"

(3, 4).clue: "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon" leads into "Late Night With" this fellow alumnus

(4, 4).clue: The name of this large, spiny rodent comes from the Latin for "thorn pig"

(5, 4).clue: Some advice for this 4-letter class--don't stand on the bike pedals with a vertical spine; it reduces power & is bad on your knees

(6, 4).clue: This prairie province that borders Montana is the only one with no natural features defining its boundaries

(1, 5).clue: This chemist was guillotined in May 1794; legend has it that the judge said, "The republic has no need of geniuses"

(2, 5).clue: Tertullian's proverb "de calcaria in carbonarium" is said to be the source of this phrase for going from bad to worse
(2, 5).correct response: out of the frying pan and into the fire

(3, 5).clue: He plays hitman & wannabe actor Barry Berkman on HBO

(4, 5).clue: EBTG is short for this band formed by Ben Watt & Tracey Thorn in 1982

(5, 5).clue: One dictionary meaning is "to be stationed so as to provide safety assistance"; would you do it for me as I bench 550?

(6, 5).clue: In 1497 Newfoundland & Labrador were claimed for England by this Italian-born explorer

(1, 1).clue: It's the most populous city on Lake Michigan

(2, 1).clue: In 2019 Randi Weingarten, pres. of this union, AFT for short, joined L.A. educators on the picket line

(3, 1).clue: He began a poem, "I celebrate myself, and sing myself"

(5, 1).clue: We'll need a lot of people in the company to get a rousing performance of "Masquerade" from this Andrew Lloyd Webber show

(6, 1).clue: A precision-guided bomb with controls that direct its fall is this "clever" type
(6, 1).correct response: a smart missile (or a smart bomb)

(1, 2).clue: The second-largest city in Tanzania is the port of Mwanza on this African lake

(2, 2).clue: After resigning as president of the American Red Cross, she founded the National First Aid Society

(3, 2).clue: A poem about these title insects "in the Garden" says, "Here come real stars to fill the upper skies"

(4, 2).clue: Cudgel: A short, heavy one of these

(5, 2).clue: Okay, so Val, who sings "Dance: Ten; Looks: Three" in this musical, should definitely be a hoofer

(1, 3).clue: This spa town, a big name in bottled water, is on the French shore of Lake Geneva

(2, 3).clue: In 2019, after more than 6 years in the post, Jim Yong Kim withdrew as president of this international lending organization

(3, 3).clue: "The Burial of the Dead" is the first of 5 sections that make up this T.S. Eliot poem

(5, 3).clue: Sets we're going to need for "Carrie": the White home, the pig farm & this festive event where things get bloody at the end

(1, 4).clue: Abu Simbel is on the shore of this body of water that didn't exist before 1970

(2, 4).clue: This author & first president of the National Organization for Women is seen here on the 50th anniversary of the 19th Amendment

(3, 4).clue: Completes the line by Stevie Smith:"I was much further out that you thought and not waving but" this

(5, 4).clue: "Kismet" is set in this world capital, so we'll need people to play mosque worshippers

(1, 5).clue: Come visit Goryachinsk, located on the shore of this oldest & deepest freshwater lake

(2, 5).clue: In 1892 he founded the Sierra Club & served as its first president

(3, 5).clue: Struck by the appearance of his cousin in a spangled mourning dress, he wrote, "She walks in beauty, like the night"

(5, 5).clue: Hire some bagpipers! Like Tommy who loves his Fiona, we shall return to this musical

(6, 5).clue: Water pressure causes these antisubmarine weapons to explode at a preselected distance below the surface

(0, 0).clue: In 2006 Arizona State University renamed its college of law in honor of this history-making woman & longtime Arizona resident
